content:
Modified contribution :
Reverse restored and Shortest removed because it requires way too lenghty hardcoded responses.
Added some constraints and tweaked the statement.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice and Simple problem.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: good idea. You should change the Output and Constraints since its not reverse mode anymore.

A lot of uncertainties and surprises for Reverse mode:
"Will there be ties for the most compatible? What to do then?" - Probably won't be
"In what order to display other compatible? What about ties?" - Stare at a single test with multiple compatible donors for a few minutes to find out how to sort. Ties? Probably won't be
"There can be no compatible donor? There can be no donor?" - if test have edge cases like this maybe there can be ties.

When the output can vary so much an explanation would be nice. So having this as a Fastest or Shortest would be better, in my opinion.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle.

You might want to change the stub generator since some of them didn't match with what is needed.
NO DONOR AVILABLE ->  NO DONOR AVAILABLE
MOST COMPATIBLE DONOR: NAME
OTHER COMPATIBLES : -> OTHER COMPATIBLE DONORS :
Otherwise, I considered it a nice reverse mode (just to match the same and not considering other conditions makes it not that hard)

I think you should reframe it to not use blood donors (and so that you don't have 198 year-old people looking for blood). After all, many people vaguely know about universal acceptors and donors and such, and so they'll start coding for things that you don't even test, making this puzzle harder than it should be. Logic wise, I think it's fine for CoC.
This might be too hard for a clash .. Would appreciate comments to help :)
